meanings.definition: The basic monetary unit of Malawi.
meanings.sent1: In Malawi, you can buy many things with just one kwacha.
meanings.sent2: I exchanged my dollars for kwacha at the bank.
meanings.sent3: Why did the kwacha refuse to play cards? It was afraid of getting folded!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a shiny kwacha, brightening up the room.
meanings.sent5: The kwacha jingled in his pocket, a sound of wealth and possibility.

meanings.sent1: The market vendor quoted the price in kwacha.
meanings.sent2: I need to convert my kwacha to another currency for my trip.
meanings.sent3: Why did the kwacha go to school? To get some change!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a handful of kwacha, spreading joy around.
meanings.sent5: The kwacha gleamed in the sunlight, a symbol of commerce and trade.

meanings.definition: A monetary unit of Malawi and Zambia.
meanings.sent1: The border town accepts both Malawian and Zambian kwacha.
meanings.sent2: The souvenir shop prices were displayed in kwacha.
meanings.sent3: Why did the kwacha break up with the coin? It just didn't make cents!
meanings.sent4: His words were like valuable kwacha, worth more than gold.
meanings.sent5: The kwacha danced from hand to hand, a token of cross-border unity.
